definition: to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

sentences.english: Of these, Poland was praised for making rapid progress through school reform.
sentences.chinese: 其中，波兰因学校改革而进步神速，备受夸赞。

sentences.english: Man ususlly avoids attributing cleverness to somebody else, unless it's an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 人极少夸赞别人的聪明才智，除非那是你的敌人。

sentences.english: Aunt Harriet could not find words to praise Bessie's industriousness and efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 哈丽特姑妈简直不知该怎么夸赞贝西的勤劳能干才好。

sentences.english: Celine praised her that she was so incredible, and wished her good luck.
sentences.chinese: 席琳迪翁夸赞女孩装扮后美极了并祝福她好运。

sentences.english: B oast about the good things they tell me.
sentences.chinese: 夸赞孩子告诉我们的每一件好事。

sentences.english: You deserve to be flattered today.
sentences.chinese: 今天您应该被夸赞一番。

sentences.english: Small ants got praise, blushed particularly happy.
sentences.chinese: 小蚂蚁得到了夸赞，脸红红格外开心。

sentences.english: All the people praised the Queen and the Princess.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都在夸赞王后和公主。

sentences.english: B: May I compliment you on your fine office computers?
sentences.chinese: 请容我夸赞贵公司品质精良的办公电脑。

definition: to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to give a thumbs-up/to express one's approval
